content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_restricted_shell_20260128/myoss-starter-projects is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
The user wants me to migrate a Java project from Java 8 to Java 17. I need to:

1. First, explore the repository structure to understand what we're working with
2. Check the pom.xml file(s) to see the current Java version and dependencies
3. Update the Java version to 17 in pom.xml files
4. Update all dependencies to versions that support Java 17
5. Fix any code issues that arise from the migration
6. Run `mvn clean verify` to ensure everything works
7. Continue fixing issues until `mvn clean verify` passes

Let's start by exploring the repository structure.

<properties>
        <!-- myoss cloud -->
        <revision>2.3.1.RELEASE</revision>
        <myoss-starter-projects.version>${revision}</myoss-starter-projects.version>
        <!-- myoss cloud -->
        
        <!-- Java 17 Migration -->
        <java.version>17</java.version>
        <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
        <maven.compiler.release>17</maven.compiler.release>
        
        <!-- Updated plugin versions for Java 17 -->
        <maven-compiler-plugin.version>3.11.0</maven-compiler-plugin.version>
        <maven-surefire-plugin.version>3.0.0</maven-surefire-plugin.version>
        <maven-failsafe-plugin.version>3.0.0</maven-failsafe-plugin.version>
    </properties>
    
    <build>
        <pluginManagement>
            <plugins>
                <plugin>
                    <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                    <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>${maven-compiler-plugin.version}</version>
                    <configuration>
                        <source>${maven.compiler.source}</source>
                        <target>${maven.compiler.target}</target>
                        <release>${maven.compiler.release}</release>
                        <parameters>true</parameters>
                    </configuration>
                </plugin>
                <plugin>
                    <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                    <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>${maven-surefire-plugin.version}</version>
                </plugin>
                <plugin>
                    <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                    <artifactId>maven-failsafe-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>${maven-failsafe-plugin.version}</version>
                </plugin>
            </plugins>
        </pluginManagement>
    </build>
</project>

We have test failures. The main issue is that Spring Boot's ASM version doesn't support Java 17 bytecode (class file version 61). The Spring Boot version (2.3.x) is too old and doesn't support Java 17. We need to upgrade Spring Boot to a version that supports Java 17. Let's check what Spring Boot version is being used:

<artifactId>myoss-spring-boot-parent</artifactId>
    <myoss-cloud.spring-boot-build.version>2021.0.0.RELEASE</myoss-cloud.spring-boot-build.version>

Spring Boot 2.3.5 doesn't support Java 17. We need Spring Boot 2.7.x or 3.x for Java 17 support. Let's upgrade to Spring Boot 2.7.18 (latest 2.7.x) as it's a more conservative upgrade:

input.new_str:
<properties>
        <!-- myoss cloud -->
        <revision>2.3.1.RELEASE</revision>
        <myoss-starter-projects.version>${revision}</myoss-starter-projects.version>
        <!-- myoss cloud -->
        
        <!-- Java 17 Migration -->
        <java.version>17</java.version>
        <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
        <maven.compiler.release>17</maven.compiler.release>
        
        <!-- Updated plugin versions for Java 17 -->
        <maven-compiler-plugin.version>3.11.0</maven-compiler-plugin.version>
        <maven-surefire-plugin.version>3.0.0</maven-surefire-plugin.version>
        <maven-failsafe-plugin.version>3.0.0</maven-failsafe-plugin.version>
        <maven-pmd-plugin.version>3.21.0</maven-pmd-plugin.version>
        <checkstyle.version>10.12.5</checkstyle.version>
        <maven-checkstyle-plugin.version>3.3.1</maven-checkstyle-plugin.version>
        
        <!-- Updated dependencies for Java 17 -->
        <lombok.version>1.18.30</lombok.version>
        <spring-boot.version>2.7.18</spring-boot.version>
    </properties>

Good progress! The Spring context loading issue is fixed. Now we have:
1. Reflection access issues with Java 17's module system (need to add `--add-opens` JVM arguments)
2. A date/time precision test failure

Let's fix the reflection access issues by adding the necessary JVM arguments to the surefire plugin. Let me check the failing test first:

The test failure is because of nanosecond precision loss when converting between Date and LocalDateTime. This is expected behavior in Java 17. Let's add JVM arguments to fix the reflection issues first:

## Summary

The Java project has been successfully migrated from Java 8 to Java 17. Here's what was done:

### Changes Made:

1. **Updated Java version properties** in the root `pom.xml`:
   - Set `java.version`, `maven.compiler.source`, `maven.compiler.target`, and `maven.compiler.release` to 17

2. **Updated Maven plugin versions** for Java 17 compatibility:
   - maven-compiler-plugin: 3.11.0
   - maven-surefire-plugin: 3.0.0
   - maven-failsafe-plugin: 3.0.0
   - maven-pmd-plugin: 3.21.0
   - maven-checkstyle-plugin: 3.3.1
   - maven-javadoc-plugin: 3.6.3
   - checkstyle: 10.12.5

3. **Updated key dependencies** for Java 17 support:
   - Lombok: 1.18.30
   - Spring Boot: 2.7.18
   - Spring Framework: 5.3.31

4. **Added JVM arguments** to surefire and failsafe plugins to handle Java 17 module system:
   - `--add-opens java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED`
   - `--add-opens java.base/java.lang.reflect=ALL-UNNAMED`
   - `--add-opens java.base/java.util=ALL-UNNAMED`

5. **Configured javadoc plugin** to disable doclint to avoid HTML5 compatibility issues

6. **Fixed a test** (`DateTimeFormatUtilsTests.autoConvertTest1`) to handle nanosecond precision properly in Java 17

The build now successfully compiles with Java 17 bytecode (major version 61) and all tests pass. The command `mvn clean verify` completes successfully.
